content.description: A gem for those who enjoy splitters.  Find the obvious small hands to fingers crack in the middle of the wall. Climb directly up the crack to the 2 bolt anchor.  **BD .75 - finger size cams** FA Ryan Ferro, 11/18
content.location: Located in the middle of the wall at the small hands and finger crack.

content.description: Start standing on a large triangular block. Climb the fins left of Itchy Face following a thin crack and utilizing the left and right aretes. Incredible dual arete slapping and heel hooks. Very sequential.
content.protection: Small gear to 0.4 BD. The gear is good, but tricky.
content.location: Start on the triangular block, as per Itchy Face Direct.

content.description: Begin by climbing the first part of El Pescado. At the second bolt proceed straight up the dihedral past the last 2 bolts to the anchor. **4 Bolts and bolted anchor** FA Jeremiah Fish, 2019
content.location: On right side of crag in big dihedral.

content.description: Begin directly under the 1st bolt of Itchy Face. Climb up through small edges and slabby moves. Once you reach the first bolt continue climbing up itchy face.  FA Ryan Ferro, 2019
content.location: Start right under first bolt of Itchy Face on slab.

content.description: The climb begins 6’ from the dihedral, below the ramp. Begin climbing up the ramp to the 1st bolt. From the first bolt climb up to the right through the path of least resistance past 2 other bolts. A 2 bolt anchor is located on the left of the dihedral.  **3 Bolts and Bolted Anchor** FA Jeremiah Fish, 2019
content.location: This route is located at the dihedral, just before the slab wall.

content.description:
**If you enjoy thin moves and slabby finishes then this is the route for you. ***

 Begin Climbing up the dihedral and clip the first 2 bolts. From the second bolt move right, across the slab to the arete. At the arete head up past 2 more bolts, finishing at a 2 bolt anchor. **4 Bolts and bolted anchor** FA Ryan Ferro, 2019
content.location: Find the dihedral with a slabby face to the right.

content.description: Mossy wall is a small, sport and trad climbing crag along the trail with great friction due to its small quartzite crystal texture. If your looking for a fun, hangout friendly spot then this is the place. With easy access to the river and good sun shine in the winter, this little crag is climbable year around. Also it is a great place to climb for the new outside climber looking to get on the sharp end with some sport or trad leads. Be advised though that Parks and Rec does no permit access to the anchors by walking to the top of the crag or topping out. All routes must be led for top rope set up. When possible use a stick clip.
